natural problem: An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die?
natural solution: The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes die :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "finite {i. i \<ge> 1 \<and> i \<le> 8}"
and h1 : "prob_space die"
and h2 : "\<forall>i. i \<ge> 1 \<and> i \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> die i = 1/8"
shows  "expectation die = 4.5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes die :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "finite {i. i \<ge> 1 \<and> i \<le> 8}"
and h1 : "prob_space die"
and h2 : "\<forall>i. i \<ge> 1 \<and> i \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> die i = 1/8"
shows  "expectation die = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: A fair 8-sided die is rolled. What is the expected value of the number rolled? The final answer is 4.5.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i. 1 \<le> i \<and> i \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> P i = 1 / 8"
and h1 : "\<forall> i. i < 1 \<or> i > 8 \<longrightarrow> P i = 0"
shows  "(\<Sum> i = 1..8. i * P i) = 4.5"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes P :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i. 1 \<le> i \<and> i \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> P i = 1 / 8"
and h1 : "\<forall> i. i < 1 \<or> i > 8 \<longrightarrow> P i = 0"
shows  "(\<Sum> i = 1..8. i * P i) = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given a discrete probability distribution where the probability of each number from 1 to 8 is $\frac{1}{8}$ and the probability of any other number is 0, find the expected value of the distribution. The final answer is 4.5.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes die :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. 1 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> die x = x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. x < 1 \<or> x > 8 \<longrightarrow> die x = 0"
and h2 : "expected_value die = (\<Sum> x \<in> {1..8}. die x * (1 / 8))"
shows  "expected_value die = 4.5"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes die :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. 1 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> die x = x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. x < 1 \<or> x > 8 \<longrightarrow> die x = 0"
and h2 : "expected_value die = (\<Sum> x \<in> {1..8}. die x * (1 / 8))"
shows  "expected_value die = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: A fair eight-sided die has faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of a single roll of this die? The final answer is 4.5.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes E :: real and p :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> p n = 1 / 8"
and h1 : "E = (\<Sum>n = 1..8. n * p n)"
shows  "E = 4.5"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: In a discrete uniform distribution with values from 1 to 8, each value has a probability of $\frac{1}{8}$. Find the expected value (E) of this distribution. The final answer is $4.5$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes die :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "finite {n. \<exists> k. n = die k}"
and h1 : "card {n. \<exists> k. n = die k} = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> k. k \<in> {1..8} \<longrightarrow> die k = real k"
shows  "sum die {1..8} / 8 = 4.5"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes die :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "finite {n. \<exists> k. n = die k}"
and h1 : "card {n. \<exists> k. n = die k} = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> k. k \<in> {1..8} \<longrightarrow> die k = real k"
shows  "sum die {1..8} / 8 = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: A fair eight-sided die has faces numbered from 1 to 8. Calculate the average value of a single roll of this die. The final answer is 4.5.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes die_faces :: "int list"
assumes h0 : "die_faces = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]"
and h1 : "length die_faces = 8"
and h2 : "distinct die_faces"
shows  "sum_list die_faces / length die_faces = 4.5"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

fixes die_faces :: "int list"
assumes h0 : "die_faces = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]"
and h1 : "length die_faces = 8"
and h2 : "distinct die_faces"
shows  "sum_list die_faces / length die_faces = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: An 8-sided die has faces numbered 1 to 8. What is the average value of the numbers on the faces of the die? The final answer is 4.5.

fixes p :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real" and E :: real

shows  "E = 4.5"

a_7.informal problem: In a discrete probability distribution, there are 8 equally likely outcomes, each with a probability of $\frac{1}{8}$. Find the expected value (E) of the random variable representing the outcome. The final answer is $4.5$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes roll :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> roll n = n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n < 1 \<or> n > 8 \<longrightarrow> roll n = 0"
and h2 : "card {n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8} = 8"
shows  "sum (\<lambda>n. roll n / 8) {n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8} = 4.5"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 An eight-sided die has its faces numbered from 1 to 8. What is the expected value of the roll of the die? The final Answer is 4.5
 ### Proof
 The expected value of one roll is the average of all the outcomes, or $E = \dfrac{1}{8}(1 + 2 + \cdots + 8) = \boxed{4.5}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes roll :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8 \<longrightarrow> roll n = n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n < 1 \<or> n > 8 \<longrightarrow> roll n = 0"
and h2 : "card {n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8} = 8"
shows  "sum (\<lambda>n. roll n / 8) {n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 8} = 4.5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: An eight-sided die has faces numbered 1 to 8. Each face has an equal probability of showing up when the die is rolled. What is the average value of the die roll? The final answer is 4.5.

shows  "E = 4.5"
a_9.formal solution:
